snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo will announce in his State of the State Message this week that all New York hospitals must adopt aggressive procedures for identifying sepsis in patients.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo will announce in his State of State Message that every hospital in New York must adopt aggressive procedures for identifying sepsis in patients, including use of countdown clock to begin treatment within an hour of spotting it; state health officials say new steps could save 5,000 to 8,000 lives annually and reduce long-term costs of condition.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo will announce in his State of the State Message this week that all New York hospitals must adopt aggressive procedures for identifying sepsis in patients.
